Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where is my desk?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That is weird.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is not funny. This is totally unprofessional.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, well, you're the one who lost the desk.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I didn't lose my desk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, calm down. Where was the last place you saw it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, who moved my desk?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you should retrace your steps.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, I am going to tell Michael and this entire office will be punished!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Colder... warmer... little warmer... there you go, ooh, warmer... warmer... warmer... warmer... warmer ... cold, cold, cold, back up... ooh, ooh, warmer, hot, red hot, hot, very hot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [In bathroom, answers phone] Dwight Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [On the phone with Dwight] Hi, Dwight, um, what sort of discounts are we giving on the 20 lb white model.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, I've given you this information, like, twenty times.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's by the ream?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah, ream.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...now, $9.78, signs and discounts 7%.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, thank you, gotta get back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wash your hands, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [On the phone] Right, oh let me just check the pricing list. Hold on one second...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Also on the phone] Sensei, hello it's Sempai...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Umm...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dwight...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what, let me give you a call right back. I'm going to uh, find it and then I'll call you back, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, I just had a ques-... Yes Sensei. Arigatou gozaimashita. Hai.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Was that your mom?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, that was my Sensei.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I thought it was your mom.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am now Sempai, which is Assistant Sensei.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Assistant to the Sensei, that's pretty cool.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Assistant Sensei.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am a practitioner of Goju Ru Karate, here in Scranton. My Sensei, Ira, recently promoted me to purple belt, and gave me the duties of a Sempai. Not that a lot of people here in America know what a Sempai is, but it is equally as respected as a Sensei.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I don't want to stay until seven again this year.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't really have any control over that Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael tends to procrastinate a bit whenever he has to do work. Umm, time cards, he has to sign these every Friday. Purchase orders have to be approved at the end of every month. And expense reports, all he has to do is initial these at the end of every quarter. But once a year, it all falls on the same Friday and that's today. I call it the Perfect Storm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing and tapping on his coffee mug] I don't want to work, I just want to bang on this mug all day.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Did you ask me here for any specific reason?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uhh, yes, I did, here's the dizzle. I have a very top secret mission for you. I want you to update all the emergency contact information.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Why is that secret? [Pam knocks and walks into Michael's office]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Pam] Hello, oh God, busy work. Ahh, get away, cretin.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Umm, I put stickers so you know where to sign.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, thank you. I know where to sign.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's just last year you...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Last year they were out of order, weren't they Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, the last pick-up for overnight deliveries is at seven. So you need to have them signed by then. Or much earlier.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Chillax, Pam. Stop Pam-M-S-ing. That's pretty good. Um, actually, I'm sending Ryan on a top secret mission. Tell her what it is.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Updating emergency contacts.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, is that really a priority?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is it a priority? Oh I don't know, um, what if there is a tornado, Pam? People's legs are crushed under rubble. "Please, would you be so kind as to call my wife? No, I can't because we don't have any emergency contact information because Pam said it wasn't a priority." Think. Think with your head, Pam. Ok, well. She walks out. That's the problem with being a boss is that when you are tough they resent you and when you are cool they walk all over you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Catch-22.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Catch-22. Yes. Why don't you give me your contact information to start with, ok, what's your cell?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, Larissa Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What's her address? [Ryan's cell phone rings]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: 117 Mount Bergin St.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in his office on his cell phone, talking in a fake high voice] Hey Ryan. This is Michael Jackson calling from Wonderland.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Do you mean Neverland?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is Tito.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Calling from... [Ryan hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Reading Jim's palm] You're major and minor lines cross at a ridge - that sucks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You making this up as you go along, aren't you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I am just following the website.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, at least I don't have cavities.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, you have very nice teeth.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Who is your emergency contact? [Ryan's phone rings]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Stacy.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [looks to see who is calling but doesn't pick up]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Taps on the glass in his office to get Ryan's attention] Pick up.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in a high pitched voice] This is Mike Tyson.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight. As Sempai, do you think there is ever going to be a day where humans and robots can peacefully co-exist?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Impossible. The way they're programmed... You're mocking me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No I'm not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look, I'm going to offer you a little piece of advice. I'm not afraid to make an example out of you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, that's not advice. What advice sounds like is this:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And this is more a ying-yang thing. The 'Michael' all cursive, the 'Scott' all caps. Left brain, right brain. Or, duality of man.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Could you practice on the forms?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No women or children, unless provoked.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, Roy?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Warehouse guy. Doesn't count.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok. Michael? Could you beat up Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah, I don't think that would happen.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Because we're friends.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because I would kick his ass.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, Dwight's a purple belt, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So? I've beaten up black belts.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, how did you know they were black belts?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They told me. After. You see, I used to run with a very tough crowd. Street Fighter types. Real, real bad people, I'm just lucky I got out.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Is your wife still your contact?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Um, ex-wife. Yeah. Um, her last name is 'Becker' now.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: 'Kay.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You don't need to write 'ex'.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And after that, nobody ever messed with the 'Damn Rascals' ever again.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sounds tough. When you're a Jet, [starts snapping] you're a Jet all the way, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You were a Jet?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Have you signed the expense reports yet?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, in theory, I have. I just need to cross some t's and dot some i's. Alright, I'm going to be in my office if anybody needs me. [Puts Dwight in a headlock] Hoo-hah. Oh, wow, sleeper hold. That's my rebuttal. Shhh. Hoo. You are the weakest link.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Argggg!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm friends with everybody in this office. We're all best friends - I love everybody here. But sometimes your best friends start coming into work late, and start having dentist appointments that aren't dentist appointments. And that's when it is nice to let them know that you can beat them up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just hit me. You'll see.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can't. I just got a manicure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, queer... [realizes he is on camera] eye. Queer eye. That's a good show. Important show. Go ahead. Do it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just have Dwight punch you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, that would be kind of worthless because I know a ton of fourteen year old girls who can kick his ass.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know a ton of fourteen year old girls?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What belt are they?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look, Dwight is a wuss. When we rented 'Armageddon'...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ... he cried at the end of it. He did.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, I told you, it was because it was New Year's Eve and it began to snow at exactly midnight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, Bruce Willis. Are they going to leave him on the asteroid?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, I'll punch you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, here we go. Alright, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kiyah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Fuuuaaaahhhhh... oohhhhh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did I want to harm Michael? The one man I've been hired to protect? No, I did not.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you ok? Are you sure you are alright?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. [Jim opens office door for Michael] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I come from a long line of fighters. My maternal grandfather was the toughest guy I ever knew. World War II veteran. Killed 20 men then spent the rest of the war in an Allied Prison Camp. My father battled blood pressure and obesity all his life. Different kind of fight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, he has to be stopped. Please, please, please, please, just ask Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, I'll buy you a bag of chips.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: French Onion?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Obviously.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to Kevin, who he is teaching to fight] Take this pen and stab me with it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Pam knocks on his door] Go away.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I just have a quick question.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I haven't signed them, ok?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, it's not that. Um, I was just wondering, since I'm probably going to have to stay late, could you ask Dwight to stay late too so he can walk me to my car?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come in. Um, Pam, I hate to break this to you but Dwight can't stop you from being mugged. He's just not tough enough.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He's a purple belt. That's really high.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I could beat up Dwight. That's ridiculous. I could murder him.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's just out there, you...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, so that's what they are saying?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, alright, where is Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, Kitchen.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Hi-yah!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Wow, that's actually pretty cool Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Now watch, let me take you from behind.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Watch out Kelly, he might sucker punch you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I didn't sucker punch you, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Really?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In case you remember, I was defending my honor... like a samurai.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? Well, the offer, Dwight, was for one punch which I absorbed. I had no idea that there would be a second punch. So, catch-22.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, fine. Tit for tit. Give it your best shot. Two punches. Go!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look, if we were in a bar right now, there would be two punches:

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, well, we are all getting excited to see this fight. The Albany branch is working right through lunch to prevent downsizing, but Michael, he decided to extend our lunch by an hour so we could all go down to the dojo and watch him fight Dwight. Fight... Fight, fight, fight, fight, fight, fight, I'm coming, fight...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I recognize that. That is Japanese for California Roll.

Quote.Speaker: Ira
Quote.Text: Uh, no, it's not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think it is. A guy told me about that.

Quote.Speaker: Ira
Quote.Text: Actually, it's a symbol for eternal discipline.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Reading Pam's palm, while she has on extremely padded gloves] Wow, that is really interesting.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Your love line- I'm just kidding. I can't see anything.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, look closer.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Jim moves his head closer and Pam taps him gently in the face] Oh, ok.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Once point for me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Gently taps Pam on the forehead] Tied up.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, you're dead.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What, what are you going to do? Bring it, Beesley. Bring it. Oh yeah, good move. Not such an ultimate fighter now.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, put me down. Put me down. [Meredith turns and looks at Jim and Pam] Oh my god, hey, put me down. Hey...

Quote.Speaker: Ira
Quote.Text: Ok, gentlemen, listen up. After a clean strike to the chest, stomach, or kidneys, I will separate you and award a point. The first person to three wins. Alright?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, Sensei!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alotta rules. Alotta rules. On the street we didn't have any rules. Maybe one - no kicks to the groin, home for dinner.

Quote.Speaker: Ira
Quote.Text: Shi mate!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hiii! [kicks Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Ira
Quote.Text: Alright, break.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What the hell was that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Ira
Quote.Text: Dwight - awarded a point.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Eat it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, that's the way you want it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Two more.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Play dirty, huh? Ok, game on, man.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Sweep the leg.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm comin' atcha man. Ok, purple belt, ok. I got him.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I got his pants.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It was my pants.

Quote.Speaker: Ira
Quote.Text: No points for pants.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, you have... No, you have something... God, you look like such an idiot! [Lots of yelling and flailing of arms by Michael and Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Ira
Quote.Text: Clean single kick, gentlemen.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Go on, I dare you to kick there again. Kick there again, I dare ya.

Quote.Speaker: Ira
Quote.Text: Ok, break. Break.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No holding.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You can't see. You can't see. Good boy. Good boy. Great boy. Two points, three points, four points. I win. I win. [Michael is using his head guard to hit Dwight] Eight points. Nine points. [Begins to hock a loogie]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, stop it! Come on! Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Open your mouth.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You talkin' to me? You talkin' to me? "Raging Bull." Pacino. Oh, I want that footage. I want it. I need it. Ah, I have to get back to work. I have lots of work... Oh, oh check this out. Come here. [Michael opens his blinds and looks at Ryan in the parking lot] There he is. Mr. Temp. Having lunch by the car. Let us play with him. This'll be hilarious. [Calls Ryan on the phone, Ryan doesn't pick up after seeing that Michael is calling] Oh, we're playing phone tag.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan's Voicemail
Quote.Text: Seven new messages. First New Message. [Michael's voice] "Hi, Ryan. This is Saddam Hussein." Next new message. "Hi, Ryan. This is your girlfriend... and I'm mad!"

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My emergency contact is Todd Packer. Todd F. Packer. Do you know what the F. stands for?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Fudge?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [knock at the door] Yeah... uh, come in. Oh, hey Karate Kid. The Hillary Swank version. Hi. How are ya?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I need to change my emergency contact information from Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ok, to what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just put "The Hospital." Contact number:

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Later Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Later, Kev. [Puts French Onion Potato Chips on Pam's desk] Have a good weekend.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, you too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Knock at the door] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I have the emergency contacts.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, just throw them on the chair. I'll take it from here. So, whatcha up to this weekend?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uh, hanging out with some friends, probably.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you're doing anything crazy, give me a shout.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, alright, I'll um, see you Monday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, bye.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Michael, did you finish yet?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This close. Dwight, may I speak with you for a minute?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm busy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, [points at himself] busier. Making the time.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Michael, can't your conversation wait till Monday.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: We want to go home.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you don't even have anyone to go home to, Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The shipping place closes in a half hour.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, but I've been carrying the load on my back all day, and if everybody would just chip in a little bit, it'd might help me out. What do you say? Let's gangbang this thing and go home. Good? Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This is illegal.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I don't care.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have been testing you the entire day. Did you know that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And I am happy to say that you have passed. So effective immediately I am promoting you from Assistant to the Regional Manager to Assistant Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, I don't know...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, I know, I know, I wouldn't be offering it if I didn't think you could handle it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can handle it. I can. Wow. So I guess this will just be my office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, title change only.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll have Pam send out a memo.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. Three month probationary period. Let's not tell anybody about this right now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just a formality.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Absolutely but not really.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, I have so much to learn from you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes you do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you, Sensei.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And, ditto.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I told Dwight that there is honor in losing. Which, as we all know, is completely ridiculous, but there is, however, honor in making a loser feel better which is what I just did for Dwight. Would I rather be feared or loved? Um, easy. Both. I want people to be afraid of how much they love me. And I think I proved that today at the dojo.

Quote.Speaker: Master
Quote.Text: [Dwight grunts] Great. Excellent. [Dwight yells] All right. That's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Dwight's pager goes off] Whoa, whoa, whoa. Hold on. Hold on. Sorry, just one second.

Quote.Speaker: Master
Quote.Text: Dwight, you can't use your pager in here, I told you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, I just...

Quote.Speaker: Master
Quote.Text: Dwight...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a sales call.

Quote.Speaker: Master
Quote.Text: Ten push-ups. Ten push-ups!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can... Yes, sensei.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do I feel bad that I haven't bonded with the other students? No, I'm not there to make friends. I'm there to attack people.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What about Oscar? Could you beat Oscar?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No problem.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know. He looks pretty scrappy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Unless he has a shiv, in which case it wouldn't be a fair fight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: True. Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No women or children. Unless provoked.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Roy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Warehouse guy. Doesn't count.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Michael. Could you beat up Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I don't think that would happen. See, I used to run with a very tough crowd, street fighter types. Real, real bad people. I'm just lucky I got out. I was a bad ass mo-fo. Stanley knows what I'm talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I've never lost a fight. You know why? My motto. Never say die.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You just said it. You just said it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, that's not how I meant it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Die. You just... You said it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shut up, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Do you think he's signed them yet?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Signed what?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Forget it. Is that chocolate-vanilla swirl?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Just chocolate. Angela? For the last time, I did not eat your chocolate-vanilla swirl.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Don't look at me. [smiles at camera]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't know why I write my name on things.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Are you going to happy hour later?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'm still recovering from last night. But maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Master
Quote.Text: Sir, your shoes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Master
Quote.Text: You're gonna have to take them off. It's a sign of respect.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Well, in my office, if you took off your shoes, it would be a sign of disrespect. Stinkyfeetville. Kind of a ying-yang. [exclaiming] Oh, stretchin'. I like to stay tight. Compact. [Dwight screaming]

Quote.Speaker: Master
Quote.Text: Here's your gear. Please put this on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you have, do you have anything in, like, black?

Quote.Speaker: Master
Quote.Text: Okay. Gentlemen. [to Michael] You ready? [to both Michael and Dwight] Okay, listen up.

Quote.Speaker: Alyssa
Quote.Text: Hi, sensei. Hi, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Master
Quote.Text: [to camera] That's Alyssa. My senpai. She just qualified for regionals.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Alyssa? I guess she's technically the senpai. But nobody really respects her. The only reason she got into regionals was because her competition was a bunch of 13-year-old girls. Put me in that division. Let's see how she does.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: God, you look like such an idiot. [both yelling] [grunting]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stan the man.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Hi, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did you hear about the fight? Well, it wasn't much of a fight, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No. Are those purchase orders signed?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I opened a big can of whoop-ass on him.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Huh? What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I went medieval on his heinie.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Are those purchase orders signed?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Stanley. I don't tell you how to do your job, do I? He...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Look, I just want to have a job, Michael. If we don't get these purchase orders...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Grow a pair, Stanley. Right? There not gonna downsize because I miss a lot of deadlines. That's not how business works, okay? [sighs] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: For the record, let me just say, Michael Scott has no honor. If he lived in Japan, he would be an outcast. Well, that's not totally true, 'cause Asians worship chest hair. I had a friend, a hairy friend, who lived in Japan. He told me the women would line up to satisfy his every need. So, and he wasn't even that attractive.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [door opening] All right. Here you go, Princess. Just finished with part one.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is what you had Ryan do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, under my tutelage.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, what about the other stuff that has to be in today?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you didn't badger me with so many questions, Pam, I could be done with it by now.
